newsitem.title: FRANCE: TENNIS-DAY 13 SNIPPETS FROM THE FRENCH OPEN.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-DAY 13 SNIPPETS FROM THE FRENCH OPEN.

text.p: A brief selection of highlights from the penultimate day of the French Open on Saturday:
Best Quote - "I'm going to eat grass" -- New French Open women's champion Iva Majoli's preparation for this month's Wimbledon, where she has never won a match.
Stat of the day - 9,000 - The number of roses presented to female visitors to Roland Garros on Saturday to mark the centenary of the French Open women's tournament.

Nearly men - Australian doubles duo Mark Woodforde and Todd Woodbridge were foiled in their latest attempt to win the only grand slam men's doubles title to have eluded them. They have won eight titles elsewhere but lost 7-6 4-6 6-3 in Saturday's French Open final to Yevgeny Kafelnikov and Daniel Vacek.
